#Text=Wikinews Shorts : April 14 , 2012
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for Saturday , April 14 , 2012 .
#Text=Yemen al-Qaeda attack leaves twelve dead
#Text=Twelve people were killed in an al-Qaeda militant attack on a security checkpoint yesterday in Aden , Yemen , according to the country 's Defense Ministry .
#Text=Four Yemeni security force members and eight al-Qaeda militants are among the dead .
#Text=Four additional people were wounded , including two al-Qaeda fighters and two members of the security force .
#Text=Al-Qaeda has been present in Yemen for several years , but gained traction last year when movements across the country called for the ouster of leader Ali Abdullah Saleh .
#Text=Officials , who were unauthorized to speak to the press , spoke of the attack on the condition of anonymity .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Ahmed Al-Haj .
#Text=" Yemen : 12 killed in militant attack in south " — Associated Press , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Mohammed Hatem .
#Text=" Yemen Says 12 Killed in Latest Fighting Between Al-Qaeda , Army " — Bloomberg News , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Iran nuclear negotiations continue
#Text=Nuclear negotiations between Iran and six other nations continued yesterday and have made progress , according to diplomats .
#Text=The meeting is the first time Iran has met with world powers in over a year .
#Text=When the meeting broke for lunch , a diplomat warned of premature optimism , however .
#Text=The diplomat also mentioned the possibility of reaching common ground in the future .

#Text=Iran continues to insist that the development of a nuclear program is intended solely for peaceful purposes , but Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has threatened a preemptive strike , saying that his country would be threatened by Iran achieving nuclear capability .
#Text=Although U.S. President Barack Obama has not eliminated the possibility of using military force against Iran , he has expressed desire for a diplomatic solution instead .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Associated Press .
#Text=" Iran nuclear negotiations : Talks ' progressing well ' " — The Times of India , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Roy Gutman .
#Text=" After ' constructive ' talks on Iran nuclear program , hopes rise for diplomacy " — The Miami Herald , April 14 , 2012
#Text=US Secret Service agents relieved in light of alleged misconduct
#Text=Approximately twelve members of the United States Secret Service , including agents , were relieved from their duties after allegations of misconduct , reportedly involving prostitution .
#Text=The agents were serving in Colombia preceding a visit by President Barack Obama .
#Text=Despite the incident , however , the agency claims that security for the President was never compromised .
#Text=All questions directed to the White House pertaining to the matter have been redirected to the Secret Service .
#Text=President Obama is visiting Colombia to participate in the Summit of the Americas , where he plans to discuss issues including trade policy .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Secret Service agents relieved of duty in Colombia amid alleged misconduct " — CNN , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Donovan Slack , Josh Gerstein , Carrie Budoff Brown .
#Text=" Secret Service scandal rocks Obama trip " — Politico , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Severe ' life-threatening ' weather forecast for Midwestern US

#Text=The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration 's Storm Prediction Center issued a high risk warning on Friday for parts of several U.S. states , with Oklahoma and Kansas expected to be the most impacted by severe weather .
#Text=Accuweather meteorologist Paul Walker told ABC News that the weekend " should be particularly dangerous " and that the issuance of a warning two days prior to severe weather is unusual .
#Text=Officials in Kansas and Oklahoma are urging residents to watch the situation and make emergency plans with their families .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Alyssa Newcomb .
#Text=" Forecasters Warn of Violent , ' Life-Threatening ' Storms for Midwest " — ABC News , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Sean Murphy .
#Text=" ' Life-threatening ' storms feared for Midwest " — The Sacramento Bee , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Antarctic emperor penguin population approximated from space

#Text=Scientists from the United States , United Kingdom , and Australia used satellite imagery to approximate the Antarctic population of emperor penguins at approximately 600,000 , nearly double that of previous estimates .
#Text=The scientists used high resolution imagery to ensure the ability to distinguish between shadows , excrement and the penguins themselves .
#Text=They also found approximately 238,000 breeding pairs of penguins in Antarctica .
#Text=Two-decade-old studies estimated this number to be between 135,000 and 175,000 .
#Text=Although the population estimate is higher than before , their numbers may decline in the coming years if current climate trends continue , according to researchers .
#Text=Researcher Phil Trathan said " Current research suggests that emperor penguin colonies will be seriously affected by climate change . "
#Text=The species , which only occupies Antarctica , is currently listed as " least concern " by the International Union for Conservation of Nature .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Alex Morales .
#Text=" Penguin Count Doubles as Satellite Sees Birds " — Bloomberg News , April 14 , 2012
#Text=Jonathan Amos .
#Text=" Emperor penguins counted from space " — BBC News , April 13 , 2012
